image.altText: A colourful children's toy block lies sideways in front of a colourful abacus.

props.synopsis: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

title.children: Thousands of documents show behind the scenes of embattled childcare industry

image.altText: A yellow and purple car impounded by police.

props.synopsis: A major police operation at Summernats has resulted in 19 vehicle seizures, hundreds of traffic offences and multiple arrests.

title.children: Police seize 19 vehicles after dangerous driving at Summernats

image.altText: Woman with bob haircut sits on a purple chair in an empty doctor waiting room.

props.synopsis: The percentage of GP clinics fully bulk-billing has almost doubled, according to a new report, however, the government says the data cannot be relied on.

title.children: Only 1 in 10 ACT GP clinics are bulk billing despite nationwide increase

image.altText: A scientist with a microscope.

props.synopsis: When Queen Elizabeth II used a product on her royal tour of Australia in 1963, journalists noticed. Then everyone wanted to use it.

title.children: The Aussie invention made famous by Queen Elizabeth II

image.altText: Generic NSW Police blue and white tape

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old man has died after a crash between a car and a truck on the Monaro Highway, south of Canberra.

title.children: ACT records first road fatality of 2026 after crash near Royalla

image.altText: A baby wombat lies in a blanket in a person's arms.

props.synopsis: There are about 40-50 active volunteer carers within ACT Wildlife, but the organisation says more are needed, especially as the temperature soars.

title.children: 'Terrible job to cuddle baby wombats': Behind the scenes as a wildlife carer

image.altText: Talbot CFA

props.synopsis: Firefighters continue to battle fires across the state after the grim news that a person had been found dead and at least 400,000 hectares have been burnt. Follow live.

title.children: Harrowing return to Harcourt as Victorians tally bushfires damage

image.altText: A flooded street.

props.synopsis: A flood emergency warning remains in place for Clermont, as already-saturated western communities are being warned of possible heavy rains from ex-Cyclone Koji.

title.children: Three people rescued in flood emergency in central Queensland as ex-Cyclone Koji moves west

image.altText: shot from a chopper, cattle running through floodwater

props.synopsis: Graziers say it was "back to the old days" as under-resourced rain gauges failed in north-west Queensland, with the widespread floods killing almost 50,000 cattle.

title.children: Blame game begins over faulty Queensland rain gauges

image.altText: Jerome Powell standing at a lectern with Donald Trump behind him.

props.synopsis: A criminal probe into the US Federal Reserve chair threatens to undermine the US dollar and the global monetary system. Local analysts warn the implications for Australia are profound.

title.children: Global financial system hangs in balance as Federal Reserve independence challenged

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: A rally on Wall Street is likely to send Australian stocks higher, as investors mostly brushed aside concerns about the US Justice Department's criminal investigation of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Wall Street rallies despite US Federal Reserve chair probe, ASX to rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: BREAKING: Trump says countries doing business with Iran face 25% tariff
Gold, oil rose on Powell probe and global uncertainty
Global financial system hangs in balance as US Fed independence challenged

image.altText: Alyssa Healy of Australia in a huddle, speaking to the team she captains before fielding

props.synopsis: Australia captain Alyssa Healy announces she will retire from all forms of cricket after a multi-format series against India in February and March.

title.children: Alyssa Healy retiring from cricket after losing 'competitive edge'

image.altText: A woman wearing a necklace and smile to camera

props.synopsis: The exclusion of novelist and academic Randa Abdel-Fattah from the upcoming Adelaide Writers' Week has prompted significant fallout in the form of withdrawals by other authors. Here's a look at how the events have unfolded, and how they could continue to.

title.children: Adelaide Writers' Week is in disarray — how did it reach this point?

image.altText: A man wearing a wide-brimmed hat and sunglasses stands next to a woman wearing sunglasses at a marina.

props.synopsis: British-Australian retiree Ian Fletcher is meant to be going on a seven-week holiday to the UK with his wife, Vicki, in April, but it may not go ahead due to passport changes.

title.children: New passport changes create headache for Australian-British dual citizens

image.altText: A young Japanese boy holds food to his mouth while sitting a table with other kids.

props.synopsis: While Australia grapples with childcare scandals, Japan is delivering top-quality care with professional chefs serving up nutritious food. So how did they do it?

title.children: From 'baby hotels' to restaurant-quality food: Lessons from Japan's childcare system

image.altText: A woman in a white t-shirt leans against a brick wall.

props.synopsis: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

title.children: 'How can I make my body look like that?': The pressures on elite female athletes

image.altText: A colourful children's toy block lies sideways in front of a colourful abacus.

props.synopsis: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

title.children: Thousands of documents show behind the scenes of embattled childcare industry

image.altText: A view of an Antarctic ice sheet.

props.synopsis: How well do you know this wide, brown land? Take our quiz.

title.children: Quiz: How well do you know Australian geography?

image.altText: A man stands by a car in the desert holding a rifle and a handgun.

props.synopsis: The Golden Globes might be over but there are plenty of award-winning films and television to get caught up on.

title.children: Where to watch the Golden Globe winners, from streaming to cinema

image.altText: A man standing on a beach trying to pitch a collapsed tent.

props.synopsis: Homeless Gazans are begging the Israeli government to allow proper shelters into the strip as winter storms batter the enclave and destroy many people's tents.

title.children: Gazans beg for shelter as winter storms batter millions and Israel limits aid

image.altText: A black and white photo of Eloise Worledge, aged 8, who went missing in 1976.

props.synopsis: Fifty years after an eight-year-old girl vanished from her Beaumaris house, police increase their reward for information from $10,000 to $1 million.

title.children: Police post $1m reward 50 years after Eloise disappeared from bedroom

image.altText: A group of children playing ice hockey on a frozen lake with houses in the background.

props.synopsis: NATO allies are now scrambling to discuss beefing up Arctic security in the hope it deflects Donald Trump away from his intensifying rhetoric towards the island territory.

title.children: Greenland government rejects American takeover 'under any circumstance'

image.altText: CCTV vision of hooded men in relation to a fatal stabbing in Mt Druitt

props.synopsis: Police have released CCTV of three men dressed in dark hoodies, who they believe can assist with inquiries.

title.children: CCTV released after second person charged over teen's fatal stabbing

image.altText: A female tennis player pumps her right fist to celebrate, as she wins her match.

props.synopsis: Daria Kasatkina defeated Greek wildcard Maria Sakkari in straight sets 7-6 (7-2) 6-4 on Monday, while Thanasi Kokkinakis beat American Sebastian Korda.

title.children: Emotional Kasatkina gets first win in front of home crowd as an Australian

image.altText: A black and white image shows the Grok image logo which says 'Grok' next to a stylised black box

props.synopsis: The AI platform championed by Elon Musk has come under significant criticism in recent weeks for its production of non-consensual images.

title.children: Grok blocked in Indonesia and Malaysia as UK launches probe over sexualised images

image.altText: A man with a blue beanie looks neutrally at something just behind the camera

props.synopsis: The case is being watched closely to see how the court might handle other genocide allegations against Israel.

title.children: Rohingya 'targeted for destruction' by Myanmar, ICJ hears

image.altText: Duct-tape panels on camouflage fabric with straps sitting on short brick fence, foliage behind

props.synopsis: A man allegedly carrying a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi has been arrested and charged by NSW Police, with his vest examined by the bomb disposal unit and deemed safe.

title.children: Man fronts court over duct taped vest near Bondi Beach

image.altText: An imam smiles against a green, leafy backdrop.

props.synopsis: An imam who was allegedly the victim of racial abuse during a roadside assault has thanked the police who helped him and his wife, and urged Australians to reject hate, Islamophobia and antisemitism.

title.children: Imam thanks police after alleged roadside assault in Melbourne

image.altText: Close up of a platypus face, poking out of a box.

props.synopsis: Landholders living alongside a northern NSW creek say a government plan to demolish a weir to improve fish migration will be devastating for the local platypus population.

title.children: Plan to save fish populations may put platypus burrows at risk

image.altText: A person with their face covered holds a sign that reads 'abolish ice'

props.synopsis: Minneapolis had been the target of a massive immigration enforcement operation in the weeks leading up to Renee Nicole Good's death. Now, the shooting has opened old wounds.

title.children: Why Minneapolis was the place where ICE launched its largest operation yet

image.altText: A main street with two graphics of a KFC sign and a McDonald's sign on either side of the image.

props.synopsis: Nutrition, vibe and culture concerns fuel these communities that want to protect their suburbs' identity and businesses from the fast food giants.

title.children: 'We can't survive it': The suburbs fighting against fast food giants

image.altText: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott attends the ceremony to mark one year since bondi junction westfield stabbing attack

props.synopsis: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, who was praised for bringing the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack to an end, has been diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of breast cancer.

title.children: 'The hero of Bondi Junction' stabbing attack diagnosed with rare cancer

image.altText: close-up of guns lying on a table.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government says it does not support the Commonwealth's proposed national gun buyback scheme, stating the territory should not have to share the cost 50:50.

title.children: NT rejects national gun buyback scheme over co-funding proposal

image.altText: A police car parked on the side of the road in front of a run-down house.

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway after a woman was found dead at a house in Buccan, south of Brisbane.

title.children: Investigation underway after woman found dead at Logan home

image.altText: Woman holds packet of illegal cigarettes and lighter.

props.synopsis: An eastern states public health expert says "it's a mystery" why Western Australia is lagging behind the rest of the country on updating its illicit tobacco laws.

title.children: WA authorities still powerless to shut down illicit tobacco and vape shops
